# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the function you asked for. It uses the built-in date functionality of Julia to extract year and month from a DateTime object, and then concatenates them into a string format "yyyymm".

```julia
using DataFrames: DataFrame

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(d -> Dates.format(d, "yyyyMM"), df[:dt])
end
```

To use this function, you simply need to pass your DataFrame to it. For example:

```julia
using DataFrames: DataFrame
df = DataFrame(dt=Date[now() + Day(i) for i in 1:5]) # create a sample dataframe
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` to the DataFrame. The `map` function applies the anonymous function `(d -> Dates.format(d, "yyyyMM"))` to each element of the `dt` column, which in turn uses the `Dates.format` function to format the DateTime object into the desired string format "yyyymm".
